answers.answer: Calm down. The three hour test is more specific if you fail that one then you just have gestational diabetes. It doesn't mean you have diabetes for the rest of your life. You'll just be put on a diet since GD babies tend to be a bit bigger. It'll be ok.

Thank you for your response. The other thing is my baby is measuring small his growth has slowed and my fluids are decreasing. My daughter was 4.1 when she was born. And he is measuring about what she did throughout the pregnancy to. So he's smaller than her probably.
Hmm.. well maybe just follow up with your Dr when you go in for your three hour test. Just to get more info.

I had gestational diabeties with my last pregnancy and not with my first. I was worried but I followed my diet and checked my blood before every meal. I was on top of it. My daughter weighed 7lbs 7oz. And was perfect in every way. After I gave birth everything went back to.normal.I'm pregnant now and I'm thinking I'll have it for this pregnancy as well. I'm preparing myself for it just in case.

question: I just got a call from the Dr that my levels were 180 and the normal range is 135 for the one hour glucose test. They asked me to come back for the three hour. What's this mean for my baby? Am I going to be diabetic for the rest of my life. I didn't have to worry about this with my first. I'm 24 and weight 183. I've only gained 24 lbs this pregnancy and am 29+1. Someone please help and explain this to me.
title: Gestational Diabeties
